clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For treatment of dermal fungal infection

contraindications.disease: Side effects incliude pruritus burning irritation erythema stinging and allergic contact dermatitis and folliculitis fissuring maceration rash and nodules
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Oxiconazole is a broad spectrum imidazole derivative whose antifungal activity is derived primarily from the inhibition of ergosterol biosynthesis which is critical for cellular membrane integrity It has fungicidal or fungistatic activity in vitro against a number of pathogenic fungi including the following dermatophytes and yeasts i T rubrum i i T mentagrophytes i i T tonsurans i i T violaceum i i E floccosum i i M canis i i M audouini i i M gypseum i i C albicans i and i M furfur i

incompatibilities.description: The metabolism of Segesterone acetate can be increased when combined with Oxiconazole
The serum concentration of Lemborexant can be decreased when it is combined with Oxiconazole
The serum concentration of Lumateperone can be decreased when it is combined with Oxiconazole
The metabolism of Ranolazine can be increased when combined with Oxiconazole
The metabolism of Clindamycin can be increased when combined with Oxiconazole
The metabolism of Rimegepant can be increased when combined with Oxiconazole
The serum concentration of Capmatinib can be decreased when it is combined with Oxiconazole
The serum concentration of Selpercatinib can be decreased when it is combined with Oxiconazole
The serum concentration of Oliceridine can be decreased when it is combined with Oxiconazole
